noun.description: An ornamental tablet, typically of metal, porcelain, or wood, that is fixed to a wall or other surface in commemoration of a person or event.
A sticky deposit on teeth in which bacteria proliferate.
examples: plaque around gum margins can lead to gingivitis

noun.description: A small, distinct, typically raised patch or region resulting from local damage or deposition of material, such as a fatty deposit on an artery wall in atherosclerosis or a site of localized damage of brain tissue in Alzheimer's disease.

origin: Mid 19th century: from French, from Dutch plak tablet, from plakken to stick.
